content:
PagedDataSource Class

Definition

Encapsulates the paging-related properties of a data-bound control (such as DataGrid, GridView, DetailsView, and FormView) that allow it to perform paging. This class cannot be inherited.

In this Article

public sealed class PagedDataSource : System.Collections.ICollection, System.ComponentModel.ITypedList
Inheritance
System.Object
PagedDataSource

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

The PagedDataSource class encapsulates the properties that allow data-source controls, such as the DataGrid, GridView, DetailsView, and FormView, to perform paging. This class is used by control developers when providing paging support to a custom data-bound control.

This class uses the best available method to enumerate over the data belonging to the current page. If the underlying data source supports indexed access (such as System.Array and System.Collections.IList), this class uses it. Otherwise, it uses the enumerator created by the GetEnumerator method.

For a list of initial property values for an instance of PagedDataSource, see the PagedDataSource constructor.

Constructors

PagedDataSource()

Initializes a new instance of the PagedDataSource class.

public PagedDataSource ();

Remarks

Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the PagedDataSource class.

The following table shows initial property values for an instance of PagedDataSource.

Property Initial Value
AllowCustomPaging false
AllowPaging false
AllowServerPaging false
CurrentPageIndex 0
PageSize 10
VirtualCount 0

Properties

AllowCustomPaging

Gets or sets a value indicating whether custom paging is enabled in a data-bound control.

public bool AllowCustomPaging { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if custom paging is enabled; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Use the AllowCustomPaging property to indicate whether custom paging is enabled. Custom paging is an optional type of paging provided specifically by the DataGrid control. ASP.NET version 2.0 data-bound control (such as GridView, DetailsView, and FormView) uses server-side paging and does not support custom paging. Custom paging and server-side paging are mutually exclusive. If you set AllowCustomPaging to true, be sure that AllowServerPaging is set to false.

For more information about custom paging, see AllowCustomPaging.

AllowPaging

Gets or sets a value indicating whether paging is enabled in a data-bound control.

public bool AllowPaging { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if paging is enabled; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Use the AllowPaging property to specify whether a data-bound control has paging enabled. ASP.NET version 2.0 data-bound controls (such as GridView, DetailsView, and FormView) also use server-side paging to provide automatic paging functionality. For more information on server-side paging, see AllowServerPaging. When using the DataGrid control, you can also provide your own custom paging logic. For more information on custom paging, see AllowCustomPaging and AllowCustomPaging.

For more information about paging support for data-bound controls, see the AllowPaging property of the data-bound control.

AllowServerPaging

Gets or sets a value indicating whether server-side paging is enabled.

public bool AllowServerPaging { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if server-side paging is enabled; otherwise, false.

Remarks

ASP.NET version 2.0 data-bound controls (such as GridView, DetailsView, and FormView) provide automatic paging functionality through server-side paging. When using an ASP.NET 2.0 data-bound control, set this property to true.

Note

Server-side paging and custom paging are mutually exclusive. If you set AllowServerPaging to true, be sure that AllowCustomPaging is set to false.

Count

Gets the number of items to be used from the data source.

public int Count { get; }
Value
Int32

The number of items to be used from the data source.

Remarks

Use the Count property to determine the number of items to be used from the data source. The value returned depends on whether paging is enabled and whether custom paging is used.

  • If paging is disabled (by setting the IsPagingEnabled property to false), the value of the DataSourceCount property is returned.

  • If paging is enabled (by setting the IsPagingEnabled property to true) and custom paging is enabled (by setting the IsCustomPagingEnabled property set to true), the value of the PageSize property is returned.

  • If paging is enabled (by setting the IsPagingEnabled property to true) and the IsLastPage property is set to false, the value of the PageSize property is returned.

  • If paging is enabled (by setting the IsPagingEnabled property to true), custom paging is disabled (by setting the IsCustomPagingEnabled property false), and the IsLastPage property is set to true, the value of the DataSourceCount property is subtracted from the value of the FirstIndexInPage property before it is returned.

Note

If the DataSource property contains null, 0 is returned.

CurrentPageIndex

Gets or sets the index of the current page.

public int CurrentPageIndex { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The index of the current page.

Remarks

Use the CurrentPageIndex property to specify or determine the index of the current page.

DataSource

Gets or sets the data source.

public System.Collections.IEnumerable DataSource { get; set; }
Value
IEnumerable

A IEnumerable implemented object that represents the data source.

Remarks

Use the DataSource property to specify or determine the data source being paged.

DataSourceCount

Gets the number of items in the data source.

public int DataSourceCount { get; }
Value
Int32

The number of items in the data source.

Exceptions
HttpException

The data source is not an ICollection implemented object.

Remarks

Use the DataSourceCount property to determine the number of items in the data source. If custom paging or server-side paging is used, the value of the VirtualCount property is returned; otherwise, the total number of items in the data source is returned.

Note

If the DataSource property contains null, 0 is returned.

FirstIndexInPage

Gets the index of the first record displayed on the page.

public int FirstIndexInPage { get; }
Value
Int32

The index of the first record displayed on the page.

Remarks

Use the FirstIndexInPage property to determine the index of the first item on the current page.

Note

If the IsPagingEnabled property is set to false, or the IsCustomPagingEnabled or AllowServerPaging properties are set to true, or the DataSource property contains null, 0 is returned.

IsCustomPagingEnabled

Gets a value indicating whether custom paging is enabled.

public bool IsCustomPagingEnabled { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if custom paging is enabled; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Use the IsCustomPagingEnabled property to determine whether custom paging is enabled.

Note

Both the IsPagingEnabled and AllowCustomPaging properties must be true for this property to return true.

IsFirstPage

Gets a value indicating whether the current page is the first page.

public bool IsFirstPage { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the current page is the first page; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Use the IsFirstPage property to determine whether the current page is the first page.

IsLastPage

Gets a value indicating whether the current page is the last page.

public bool IsLastPage { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the current page is the last page; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Use the IsLastPage property to determine whether the current page is the last page.

IsPagingEnabled

Gets a value indicating whether paging is enabled.

public bool IsPagingEnabled { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if paging is enabled; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Use the IsPagingEnabled property to determine whether paging is enabled.

Note

The AllowPaging property must be true and the PageSize property cannot be set to 0 for this property to return true.

IsReadOnly

Gets a value indicating whether the data source is read-only.

public bool IsReadOnly { get; }
Value
Boolean

false for all cases.

Remarks

This property is implemented to always return false, which indicates that the data source can be modified in all cases.

IsServerPagingEnabled

Gets a value indicating whether server-side paging support is enabled.

public bool IsServerPagingEnabled { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if paging is enabled and server-side paging is indicated using the stem.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.AllowServerPaging* property; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Server-side paging is enabled when the AllowPaging and AllowServerPaging properties are both set to true, and the amount of data retrieved by the data source cannot be displayed in a single page.

IsSynchronized

Gets a value indicating whether access to the data source is synchronized (thread-safe).

public bool IsSynchronized { get; }
Value
Boolean

false for all cases.

Remarks

This property is derived from the System.Collections.ICollection class and is overridden to always return false to indicate that this class is not thread-safe.

For more information on the IsSynchronized property, see the IsSynchronized property of the System.Collections.ICollection interface.

PageCount

Gets the total number of pages necessary to display all items in the data source.

public int PageCount { get; }
Value
Int32

The number of pages necessary to display all items in the data source.

Remarks

Use the PageCount property to determine the number of pages necessary to display all items in the data source.

Note

If the DataSource property is null, 0 is returned. If the IsPagingEnabled property is set to false or the DataSourceCount property is set to 0 or less, 1 is returned.

PageSize

Gets or sets the number of items to display on a single page.

public int PageSize { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The number of items to display on a single page.

Remarks

Use the PageSize property to specify or determine the number of items to display on a single page.

SyncRoot

Gets the object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

public object SyncRoot { get; }
Value
System.Object

An object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

Remarks

The object returned in this implementation is the PagedDataSource object itself.

For more information on the SyncRoot property, see the SyncRoot property of the System.Collections.ICollection interface.

VirtualCount

Gets or sets the virtual number of items in the data source when custom paging is used.

public int VirtualCount { get; set; }
Value
Int32

The virtual number of items in the data source when custom paging is used.

Remarks

Use the VirtualCount property when custom paging or server-side paging is used to determine the virtual number of items in the data source. For more information on the VirtualCount property, see VirtualItemCount.

Methods

CopyTo(Array,Int32)

Copies all the items from the data source to the specified Array, starting at the specified index in the Array.

public void CopyTo (Array array, int index);
array
Array

A zero-based Array that receives the copied items from the data source.

index
Int32

The first position in the specified Array to receive the copied contents.

Remarks

Use this method to copy the contents of the data source into the specified System.Array, starting at the specified index. The System.Array is often used to iterate through the items in the data source.

GetEnumerator()

Returns a IEnumerator implemented object that contains all items in the data source.

public System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator ();
Returns
IEnumerator

A IEnumerator implemented object that contains all items in the data source.

Remarks

Use this method to create a System.Collections.IEnumerator that can be iterated through to get each item in the data source. To access the item at the current position in the enumerator, use the Current property. Use the MoveNext method to move to the next item in the collection. To move the enumerator to its initial position, use the Reset method.

Note

When you initially get the enumerator or use the Reset method to move the enumerator to the first item in the collection, you must call the MoveNext method. Otherwise, the item represented by the Current property is undefined.

GetItemProperties(PropertyDescriptor[])

Returns the PropertyDescriptorCollection that represents the properties on each item used to bind data.

public System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection GetItemProperties (System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor[] listAccessors);
listAccessors
PropertyDescriptor[]

An array of PropertyDescriptor objects that contains the list name returned. This can be null.

Returns
PropertyDescriptorCollection

The PropertyDescriptorCollection that represents the properties on each item used to bind data.

Remarks

Use the GetItemProperties method to create a System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection that represents the properties on each item used to bind data. If the DataSource property is null or is not a System.ComponentModel.ITypedList implemented object, null is returned. For more information on the GetItemProperties method, see GetItemProperties.

GetListName(PropertyDescriptor[])

Returns the name of the list. This method does not apply to this class.

public string GetListName (System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor[] listAccessors);
listAccessors
PropertyDescriptor[]

An array of PropertyDescriptor objects that contains the list name returned. This can be null.

Returns
String

String for all cases.

Remarks

This method is inherited from System.ComponentModel.ITypedList and is not applicable to this class. It has been implemented to return System.String.Empty for all cases.
